thread.title: Perkins Loans Are Dead On Arrival--Again as September's Swan Song is Sung
thread.title_full: Perkins Loans Are Dead On Arrival--Again as September's Swan Song is Sung

title: Perkins Loans Are Dead On Arrival--Again as September's Swan Song is Sung
text:
Perkins Loans Are Dead On Arrival--Again as September's Swan Song is Sung Written by: John Sandman 10/02/15 - 8:44 AM EDT 
NEW YORK ( MainStreet ) — The U.S. Senate failed to take action on a last-ditch effort to renew the Federal Perkins Student Loan program, letting it lapse once and for all . 
For the loan to continue, both houses of Congress needed to pass legislation that would renew the program by September 30, the last day of the 2015 fiscal year. Perkins loans expired in the Fall of 2014, but got a year-long reprieve by Congress. 
The House of Representatives, where the GOP has a majority, actually gave Perkins a majority on Tuesday. But the Senate, where Republicans are also in control, did not go along. Senator Lamar Alexander (R-Tenn.), chair of the Health, Education, Labor and Pension committee, has called for the program's shut down as part of an effort to simplify and streamline the Federal government’s student loan programs. More Headlines
